articles.title: Aleksandra Lazić
articles.contents:
Aleksandra Lazic
          
          
          About
          Research
          Blog
          CV
          Stay in Touch
          ☰
          
          
      
        
          
            
              
            
              Aleksandra Lazić
            
            
              
                
                    
                      
                        ORCID iD
                      
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      
                        Research
                      
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      
                        CV
                      
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      
                        Blog
                      
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      
                        Twitter
                      
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      
                        Stay in Touch
                      
                    
                  
                                  
            
          
        
        
        
          
            
            About me
            I am a social psychology PhD Candidate and Research Assistant at the University of Belgrade Department of Psychology (LIRA Lab).
            My PhD project explores how people make vaccination decisions in social interactions with others and its implications for public communication, using online experiments and media content analysis. More broadly, I am interested in how people decide to help others and contribute to the public good.
            Since 2022, I am part of the research team of the Reason4Health project. My main role is to lead and coordinate a content analysis study of online media coverage of alternative medicine in Serbia.
            I co-founded and maintain LIRA’s open access repository of psychological instruments in Serbian (REPOPSI).
            In my spare time, I like to draw, dabble in #SciComm, and teach myself R. I created this website with {distill} and {postcards}.
            
            
            Research interests
            Vaccination, Public Health Communication, Social Norms, Conspiracy Theories & Misinformation, Social Dilemmas, Altruism, Intergroup Relations, Open Science
            
            
            Methods
            Experiments (Lab), Online Surveys, Systematic Review (with Quantitative Synthesis), Content Analysis, Correlational Research, Economic Experiments (Games), Psychometric Methods/Scale Development
            
            
            Education
            University of Belgrade | M.A. in Psychology | 2016
            University of Belgrade | Diploma in Psychology | 2015
            
          
        
      
    

    
      
        
          
            
              
            
              Aleksandra Lazić

              About me
              I am a social psychology PhD Candidate and Research Assistant at the University of Belgrade Department of Psychology (LIRA Lab).
              My PhD project explores how people make vaccination decisions in social interactions with others and its implications for public communication, using online experiments and media content analysis. More broadly, I am interested in how people decide to help others and contribute to the public good.
              Since 2022, I am part of the research team of the Reason4Health project. My main role is to lead and coordinate a content analysis study of online media coverage of alternative medicine in Serbia.
              I co-founded and maintain LIRA’s open access repository of psychological instruments in Serbian (REPOPSI).
              In my spare time, I like to draw, dabble in #SciComm, and teach myself R. I created this website with {distill} and {postcards}.
              
              
              Research interests
              Vaccination, Public Health Communication, Social Norms, Conspiracy Theories & Misinformation, Social Dilemmas, Altruism, Intergroup Relations, Open Science
              
              
              Methods
              Experiments (Lab), Online Surveys, Systematic Review (with Quantitative Synthesis), Content Analysis, Correlational Research, Economic Experiments (Games), Psychometric Methods/Scale Development
              
              
              Education
              University of Belgrade | M.A. in Psychology | 2016
              University of Belgrade | Diploma in Psychology | 2015

articles.title: Research & Outreach
articles.contents:
Contents
Research
Vaccination/Health Decisions & Public Communication
Biases in Altruism and Cooperation
Open Science

Outreach

Research
Vaccination/Health Decisions & Public Communication
Lazić, A., & Žeželj, I. (2022). Negativity in online news coverage of vaccination rates in Serbia: A content analysis. Psychology & Health. https://doi.org/10.1080/08870446.2022.2121962. Open Access PDF. Open Data.
Lazić, A., & Žeželj, I. (2021). A systematic review of narrative interventions: Lessons for countering anti-vaccination conspiracy theories and misinformation. Public Understanding of Science, 30(6), 644–670. https://doi.org/10.1177/09636625211011881. Open Data.
Lazić, A., Kalinova, K. N., Packer, J., Pae, R., Petrović, M. B., Popović, D., Sievert, D. E. C., & Stafford-Johnson, N. (2021). Social nudges for vaccination: How communicating herd behaviour influences vaccination intentions. British Journal of Health Psychology, 26(4), 1219–1237. https://doi.org/10.1111/bjhp.12556. Open Data. Registered Report Protocol.
Teovanović, P., Lukić, P., Zupan, Z., Lazić, A., Ninković, M., Žeželj, I. (2021). Irrational beliefs differentially predict adherence to guidelines and pseudoscientific practices during the COVID-19 pandemic. Applied Cognitive Psychology, 35(2), 486–496. https://doi.org/10.1002/acp.3770. Open Data.
Biases in Altruism and Cooperation
Baucal, A., & Lazić, A. (2022). Selfish genes or selfish memes: The effect of genetic relatedness versus value similarity on altruism. Psihologija, 55(4), 379–395. https://doi.org/10.2298/PSI211107009B. Open Data.
Lazić, A., Purić, D., & Krstić, K. (2021). Does parochial cooperation exist in childhood and adolescence? A meta-analysis. International Journal of Psychology, 56(6), 917–933. https://doi.org/10.1002/ijop.12791. Open Access PDF. Open Data.
Open Science
Parsons, S., Azevedo, F., Elsherif, M. M., … Lazić, A., …, & Aczel, B. (2022). A community-sourced glossary of open scholarship terms. Nature Human Behaviour, 6, 312–318. https://doi.org/10.1038/s41562-021-01269-4. Open Access PDF.
Lazić, A., Lazarević Lj. B., Purić, D., & Žeželj, I. (2021). REPOPSI: The open repository of psychological instruments in Serbian. In N. Miljković, P. Pejović, & M. Cvetanović (Eds.), Proceedings of the Third National Conference with International Participation titled Application of free software and open hardware PSSOH 2020 (pp. 51–56). University of Belgrade School of Electrical Engineering and Academic Mind. https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.4064293.
Outreach
Under construction :)
